title: Man and woman found dead in Fairhaven home on New Year’s Eve
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News The two were found inside a Jameson Street residence on Wednesday night, officials said.
A man and a woman were found dead inside a Fairhaven residence on New Year’s Eve, according to Bristol District Attorney Thomas Quinn’s office.
The victims were identified as Rafael Pedraza, 60, and Brenda Rosario, 51.

title: Kick off 2026 with these New England winter events
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Scenic Six Skiing at night, free things to do in Boston, and more.
Boston, MA,12/31/2024, Steven Rose of Boston Ice Effects, left, steadied the ice sculpture.
The ice sculptures were assembled on City Hall Plaza for First Night celebrations as Boston began to celebrate New Year’s Eve.

title: Take a break from scrolling at New Bedford’s 25-hour ‘Moby Dick’ marathon
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Books Some 2,500 people are expected at the 30th annual marathon reading of Melville’s classic — a ritual organizers call “cathartic and communal.

We live in an age of endless quick-scrolling, screens and flitting through bits and blurbs on social media without pause, a world where robots write essays.

title: Patriots’ Week 2 win over the Dolphins was the start of a memorable season
author: Chad Finn
bullets: New England Patriots It’s fitting that the Patriots wrap up their remarkable regular season against the Dolphins, against whom they first showed flashes of excellence way back in Week 2.
Drake Maye (center) threw for 230 yards and two touchdowns and added another on the ground in the Patriots' Week 2 win over the Dolphins.

title: Police on Cape Cod warn against viral door-kicking social media trend
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News “Try doing something kind or positive for those in your community instead of trying to scare someone,” police said.
Police in a Cape Cod town are warning residents about a viral door-kicking prank with potentially dangerous consequences.

The Bourne Police Department said Monday they have joined a growing list of law enforcement offices nationwide that have dealt with incidents related to the trend, which involves people kicking residents’ doors and running away.

title: Beheaded birds found dumped off Dedham bridge, officials say
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News Animal control officers say the birds were found along a canal that is part of the Stony Brook Reservation.
By Darin Zullo January 1, 2026 Less than a minute to read 10Share ShareSend this article to your social connections.
Dedham Animal Control is investigating after several beheaded birds were found dumped off a bridge on Sawmill Lane.

title: Person falls to death on Boylston Street on New Year’s Eve
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News The person was found "nonviable," a Boston police spokesperson said, after falling from the Mandarin Oriental.
ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A person died in Back Bay on New Year’s Eve after falling from the Mandarin Oriental on Boylston Street, police said.
